mcqs.mcquestion:
Consider the following statements regarding the basic technological innovations of the Upper Palaeolithic culture:

I. The basic technological innovation of the Upper Palaeolithic period is the method of producing parallel sided blades from a carefully prepared core.
II. One good core of parallel-sided blades once prepared, can yield many this kind of blades with very little or no further preparation.
III. The upper Palaeolithic tools have been found in Rajasthan, parts of the Ganga and Belan valleys, Central and Western India, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka.

Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?
mcqs.mcqSolution: The middle Palaeolithic culture slowly evolved into the Upper Palaeolithic culture. The basic technological innovation of the Upper Palaeolithic period is the method of producing parallel sided blades from a carefully prepared core. One good core of this kind, once prepared, can yield many parallel-sided blades with very little or no further preparation.

mcqs.mcquestion: The finding of artefacts from which of the following Mesolithic sites shows that the Mesolithic communities were in touch with the people of Harappan Civilisation:
mcqs.mcqSolution: From the sites of Bagor in Rajasthan and also Langhnaj in Gujarat we came to know that these Mesolithic communities were in touch with people of the Harappan and other Chalcolithic cultures and traded various items with them. From Bagor three copper arrowheads, typical of the Harappan Civilization, have been found.

mcqs.mcquestion: Which of the following Mesolithic site(s) is/are among the most important and extensively studied sites of Mesolithic culture:
mcqs.mcqSolution: Some of the most important and extensively studied sites of Mesolithic culture are Bagor in Rajasthan, Langhnaj in Gujarat, Sarai Nahar Rai, Chopani Mando, Mahdaha and Damdama in Uttar Pradesh, and Bhimbetka and Adamgarh in Madhya Pradesh.

mcqs.mcquestion:
Consider the following statements regarding the basic technological innovations of the Upper Palaeolithic culture:

I. The basic technological innovation of the Upper Palaeolithic period is the method of producing parallel sided blades from a carefully prepared core.
II. One good core of parallel-sided blades once prepared, can yield many this kind of blades with very little or no further preparation.
III. The upper Palaeolithic tools have been found in Rajasthan, parts of the Ganga and Belan valleys, Central and Western India, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka.

Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?
mcqs.mcqSolution: The middle Palaeolithic culture slowly evolved into the Upper Palaeolithic culture. The basic technological innovation of the Upper Palaeolithic period is the method of producing parallel sided blades from a carefully prepared core. One good core of this kind, once prepared, can yield many parallel-sided blades with very little or no further preparation.

mcqs.mcquestion: The finding of artefacts from which of the following Mesolithic sites shows that the Mesolithic communities were in touch with the people of Harappan Civilisation:
mcqs.mcqSolution: From the sites of Bagor in Rajasthan and also Langhnaj in Gujarat we came to know that these Mesolithic communities were in touch with people of the Harappan and other Chalcolithic cultures and traded various items with them. From Bagor three copper arrowheads, typical of the Harappan Civilization, have been found.

mcqs.mcquestion: Which of the following Mesolithic site(s) is/are among the most important and extensively studied sites of Mesolithic culture:
mcqs.mcqSolution: Some of the most important and extensively studied sites of Mesolithic culture are Bagor in Rajasthan, Langhnaj in Gujarat, Sarai Nahar Rai, Chopani Mando, Mahdaha and Damdama in Uttar Pradesh, and Bhimbetka and Adamgarh in Madhya Pradesh.

mcqs.mcquestion: Which of the following site is located in Montegomari district of Punjab in Pakistan?
mcqs.mcqSolution: Harappa is located in Montegomari.

mcqs.mcquestion: What was the main feature of Indus Valley Civilization?
mcqs.mcqSolution: Town planning was the main feature of Indus Valley Civilization.

mcqs.mcquestion: Which of the following was the port town of Indus Valley Civilization?
mcqs.mcqSolution: Lothal was the port town of Indus Valley Civilization.

mcqs.mcquestion:
When cold front passes over an area then
1. temperature decreases.
2. relative humidity increases.
3. sky becomes clear.
mcqs.mcqSolution: Relative humidity (RH) decreases when cold front passes over an area. Cold fronts are associated with clear sky and weather while warm fronts have clouds and rainfall.

mcqs.mcquestion:
Secondary circulation in atmosphere consists of
1. polar easterlies
2. temperate cyclones
3. mountain winds
4. monsoon
mcqs.mcqSolution: Primary circulation – planetary winds, includes polar easterlies. Secondary circulation – cyclones, anticyclones, monsoon etc Tertiary winds – local winds like land and sea breezes, mountain and valley winds etc.

mcqs.mcquestion: Which of the following affects atmospheric pressure?
mcqs.mcqSolution: The pressure exerted by air on the surface of the earth is called as atmospheric pressure. The pressure varies from region to region.

mcqs.mcquestion: The weight of water vapour per unit weight of air is
mcqs.mcqSolution: Specific humidity is expressed as grams per kg of air. The temperature at which saturation occurs is called dew point. The weight of water vapour per unit weight of air is called specific humidity.

mcqs.mcquestion:
Consider the following statements.

    Asylum is the legal protection granted to people in any country who are afraid to return to their home country.
    Domicile means to stay in a country with the intention of making it his or her permanent home.
    Expelling an alien is called deportation.
    Resident is one who resided in the country for certain number of days.

Which of the above statement is / are correct.
mcqs.mcqSolution: All of the above

mcqs.mcquestion:
Which of the statement is incorrect.

    The facility of overseas citizenship of India was made available to all the person of Indian origin of any country.
    Dual citizens do not have voting rights.
    Neither can they be elected to Public Office nor they eligible for defence job.
    Dual citizens do not required visa for travel to India.
mcqs.mcqSolution: Option 1 is correct.

mcqs.mcquestion: In which of the following union territory a Council of Ministers is elected?
mcqs.mcqSolution: Delhi and Puducherry are the only two union territories where a Council of Ministers is elected.

mcqs.mcquestion: Who governs the union territory "Daman and Diu"?
mcqs.mcqSolution: Administrator

mcqs.mcquestion:
Consider the following statements.

    Asylum is the legal protection granted to people in any country who are afraid to return to their home country.
    Domicile means to stay in a country with the intention of making it his or her permanent home.
    Expelling an alien is called deportation.
    Resident is one who resided in the country for certain number of days.

Which of the above statement is / are correct.
mcqs.mcqSolution: All of the above

mcqs.mcquestion:
Which of the statement is incorrect.

    The facility of overseas citizenship of India was made available to all the person of Indian origin of any country.
    Dual citizens do not have voting rights.
    Neither can they be elected to Public Office nor they eligible for defence job.
    Dual citizens do not required visa for travel to India.
mcqs.mcqSolution: Option 1 is correct.

mcqs.mcquestion:
Consider the following statements:

    1. Real GDP is calculated in a way such that the goods and services are evaluated at constant prices.

    2. Nominal GDP is the value of GDP at the current prevailing prices.

    3. The ratio of Real GDP to Nominal is known as Index of prices (GDP Deflator)
mcqs.mcqSolution: 1 and 2

mcqs.mcquestion: Choose the false statement among the following statements:
mcqOptions: Consumer Price Index (CPI) is the index of prices of a given basket of commodities which are bought by the representative consumer.
The weights of representative goods are constant in GDP Deflator– but they differ according to production level of each good in CPI.
The index for wholesale prices is called Wholesale Price Index (WPI), in USA it is referred to as Producer Price Index (PPI).
CPI includes prices of goods consumed by the representative consumer, hence it includes prices of imported goods. GDP deflator does not include prices of imported goods.
mcqs.mcqSolution: The weights of representative goods are constant in GDP Deflator– but they differ according to production level of each good in CPI.

mcqs.mcquestion: Which is the oldest political party in India?
mcqs.mcqSolution: The Indian National Congress was founded by Allan Octavian Hume, in 1885 in Mumbai.
